title: ISic000366. Epitaph of Caius Pompeius Felix and Scribonia Restituta
body:
Facsimile Images

1CPO.PEIFELICIS
2ETSC.[..]ONIAERESTI
3.UTAE

Apparatus criticus

Text based upon photograph, after Korhonen

English translation

(tomb) of Gaius Pompeius Felix and Scribonia Restituta

commentary

Given that both names reflect senatorial families attested in the area, this is assumed to be a freedman and freedwoman of the families. Korhonen notes the absence of 'Dis Manibus' as encouraging a first-century date, alongside the palaeography. Castelli and Ferrara report the right fragment only as a separate text, in addition to reporting the entire text, following a notice in Amico.

bibliography

  • 10.7084 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • Amico 1741 225 no.29 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002186
  • Castelli 1769 182 no. 102 (269 no.46) https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002084
  • Castelli 1784 192 no. 117 (288 no.47) https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002083
  • Ferrara 1829 358 no. 4 (380 no.3) https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002005
  • 119 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
